subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * A {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|CJK compatibility ideograph}} exists at U+FA66 for the alternative {{w|Kanji|Japanese form}} of the [[radical]] with only one dot and three strokes that is used for {{w|Jōyō kanji}} characters.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* Depending on the computer font used, this character may appear be to either <font size=4>⻍</font>, <font size=4>⻎</font> or <font size=4>⻌</font> <!--Glyphs from CJK Radicals Supplement -->
* The form <font size=4>⻍</font> ''(two dots, four strokes)'' is the traditional form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}} which is used in Japanese {{w|Kyūjitai}} / {{w|Hyōgai kanji}}, Korean {{w|Hanja}} and Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nom}}.
* The form <font size=4>⻎</font> ''(one dot, four strokes, same as the animated stroke diagram)'' is the revised form for {{w|traditional Chinese}} used in the {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Song typeface}} ([[宋體]]) in Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau. This form is also the calligraphic form used in {{w|regular script}} ([[楷書]]) in all regions.
* The form <font size=4>⻌</font> ''(one dot, three strokes)'' is used in the {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Song typeface}} ([[宋體]]) in mainland China ''(based on {{w|Xin Zixing}}, {{w|zh:新字形|新字形}})'' and the {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Ming typeface}} ([[明朝体]]) in Japan for {{w|Jōyō kanji}} characters.
* This character is not to be confused with visually similar but unrelated {{l|mul|廴}} ''(Radical 54)''.

[[Category:CJKV radicals]]
